comments: Some others hated her. I loved her. She skipped the BS and often would bypass students question in order to cover all the material. There was no surprise on the final and she would answer any question you had after class. She kept pace with the material which is important for the final and later the bar. Somewhat disheveled but informative.

Teach yourself. Highly disorganized, with notes and in class. Notes are not left up with important information and told just get them online and they are not online. Hard to follow when the most common phrase is \'that\'s not what I meant to say\' is done multiple times a class. Asks ?s on exams that can\'t be determined with information given in class

She skipped over half of our classes and was rude and disrespectful several times throughout the semester. Constantly acted as if every conclusion was easy to come to when students were struggling. Relied heavily on online learning because she did not attend class for personal reasons. Not effective. Did her students a disservice.
Very easily frustrated. Gets very flustered as well. Not capable of thinking outside of her notes. If it isn\'t in her notes, she has no idea.
She has dry humor, but a good prof that knows her stuff. See through her attitude and remarks and she is actually one of the best profs at UD-Law.

Extremely careless in presenting material to students. Her slides, EXAMS, and emails are inundated with grammar and spelling errors. Does not treat students with proper respect. No, we aren\'t Harvard students, but we deserve some element of professionalism.

This professor demonstrates anybody with a JD and manual can teach a law school class. She was often disorganized. She could be short and rude with students. She struggles understanding how things work even when a case is pretty clear how things work.

She relies heavily on her notes to teach class. Yet, she is very disorganized about using them. If you ask a question & the answer is not in her notes you\'ll throw her off. She is not clear in her communication, then easily gets frustrated when students don\'t understand the subject matter like she thinks they should. Open book 2 hypo essay test.

Yet another example of Harvard Law school grad that is unorganized, unclear, and leaves those around them with no clear picture of what their intentions are. If this is an example of what the best law school in the nation has to offer then we are doomed.

She is a terrible teacher! She came to class always with an attitude and would make snippy comments. Very disorganized and scattered. Not a friendly professor at all. I definitely did not like her and would not recommend her to anyone.
NO...No way..never again...no.. she is rude to some students and too friendly to others. Really shows favoritism. Is this an example of a Harvard Lawyer??? Never ever ever again...no..no way...no..
Thumbs Down on this Harvard Grad. Do Not Recommend!! You were warned.
Unclear. Unorganized. Hard time making her point. An unfortunate hire for the law school.
